data.name: Pickleball One
data.description:
Dive into America's fastest-growing sport while making new friends! Master Pickleball anytime, anywhere, whether as a single player or with up to 4 participants. Beyond just singles and doubles, this app includes in-depth fitness and training modules, that will elevate both your physical and virtual gameplay. Experience a mixed-reality setting for immersive wall drills, practice sessions, and workouts.

Introductory price: $24.99

ENJOY REAL-FEEL GAMEPLAY - Physics, sound, and haptics have been carefully mapped to mirror the real game. Scoring and rules are based on the USA Pickleball Association’s Official Rulebook and support for several grip attachments makes every swing feel authentic.

CONNECT & COMPETE WITH FRIENDS - Seamlessly set up and enjoy singles or doubles matches, or even invite friends to watch. Pickleball thrives on social interaction, and in VR, it's no different.

ACE YOUR TRAINING AND FITNESS GOALS - Hone skills like serves, dinks, and volleys. Enhance stamina and leg strength with rhythm-based exercises. Celebrate your effort with achievements and monitor progress via a workout calendar.

MOVE FREELY IN MIXED REALITY - Get ready to play with a clear view of your surroundings using the full-color Passthrough feature found in Meta Quest 3 and Meta Quest Pro. Whether engaging in wall practice or fitness workouts, you can now really move without fear of running into something.

Pickleball One is the ultimate social sports and fitness platform.

VERSION 2.2.4
--- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- —
ENHANCEMENTS
--- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- —

New court  - Gym
We heard you - we've added the "Gym" court for you to enjoy in single player and multiplayer modes.

Court upgrade - New "Festival Mode" in Forest
Light up the night in the Forest court by toggling on "Festival Mode" using the left-hand controller menu button.

Casual Mode enhancement -  Send AI players back to the baseline
Send your AI players back to the baseline by pressing the Y button during casual play mode in single or multiplayer.

New feature -  Paddle rotation
We heard you - when you're using the "Default" grip setting, hold the paddle-hand grip trigger and tilt the thumbstick left and right to rotate the paddle.

New grip attachment support - VirtualPrintality VR Sports Grip Adapter (Meta Quest 3) 
Under Paddle settings, we have added a grip preset for VirtualPrintality VR Sports Grip Adapter for the Meta Quest 3.

New grip attachment support - SolidSlime Adapter (Meta Quest 3) 
Under Paddle settings, we have added a grip preset for Solid Slime Adapter for the Meta Quest 3.

New DLC court + paddle package -  Frostbite Field
Escape into a winter wonderland surrounded by glacial rocks and ice flows with the Frostbite Field DLC court. Toggle on "Festival Mode" using the left-hand controller menu button. This DLC also includes two Frostbite-themed paddles (Tundra Tapper & Snowy Beak).

--- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- —
BUG FIXES
--- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- —

Bug - Fixed AI being put on wrong side of court at end of match.

Bug - Fixed player’s paddle being changed when they join a match.

Multiplayer - Fixed spectators not being returned to their selected region after leaving multiplayer.

User Interface - Fixed kitchen highlight not lining up properly with court lines.

User Interface - In-game "News" now available

Updated Forest Court
Improved lighting, audio, and color scheme for Forest court. The Forest Court is now a daytime environment.

Gameplay - Adjusted the "Not Underarm Serve Fault" to be more tolerant
We heard you - we have adjusted the detection of "Not-Underarm Serve Fault" to be more tolerant.

Multiplayer - Added Kick Player and Ban Player options for the game host
We heard you - The host can now Kick (remove a player from the current session) and also Ban (remove a player from the current session and prevent them from joining the room session again). As host, select "More Details" on the player you wish to kick or ban under the "Match Details" menu, which can be accessed in-game with the left hand menu button.

Performance - Smoothed out AI and player movement
Avatars in AI games and multiplayer now move more smoothly.

User Interface - Updated Text font to be more clear at distance
In-game text is now more legible.

VERSION 1.4.7
--- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- —
ENHANCEMENTS
--- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- --- —

Orion Physics System
A new and improved physics system that brings even more true-to-life physics to Playin Pickleball with added consistency and control for bringing your smash and dinking game to life!

Adapter Support Update and Setting
Full adapter support for the SolidSlime Adapter and the VR Tennis Adapter (Virtual Printality/Etsy Model) in addition to the Custom Grip option. When selecting an adapter, you’ll also have the option of using your non-paddle hand to navigate the UI.

“Spin to Power Ratio” Paddle Physics Adjustment 
Under Paddle Settings in the main menu, users can just the “Spin” to “Power” ratio for your paddle for even more control. This setting is persistent between matches and applies to whichever paddle you choose to use. In a future release, we will add the ability to adjust your “Spin to Power” ratio in game. For now, this must be adjusted in Paddle settings at the main menu.

Party Chat Volume Management in Game 
Added the ability to adjust other player’s chat volume and mute your microphone in multiplayer games from the “Match Details” button available within the in-game pause menu. 

In-Game Clock Feature and Setting 
Added an in-game “clock” during matches & practice modes that can be enabled for each user under “General Settings.” The clock can be displayed either atop the scoreboard or upon the left corner of the net when enabled. 

Ball Trail Colour Adjustment 
Top spin will generate a red ball trail, while backspin will generate a blue ball trail.

Increased Haptic Feedback (Vibration) and Haptic Control Setting 
Increased haptic intensity when you strike the ball, as well as settings under “General” to allow you to change the intensity to your preference.

“Exit” Button Added to Quit the Game 
The main menu now features an “Exit” button you can click to close the game.

Default (Home) Court Location 
In the Court Settings menu, there is a “home” icon you can click so that the game will always launch into your preferred court location.

Added “Longest Hit Rally” and “Current Hit Rally” statistics to Free Play 
The scoreboard will now display statistics on how many hits have occurred in your current rally, and will also display the highest number of hits achieved in a rally across the entire Free Play session.

Meta User Reporting Implemented 
You can now take advantage of Meta User Reporting functionality.

New US South Central Location Available - Added a new region for players to play matches in - USSC - US South Central, based in Dallas, Texas.

While we were excited to share our new updated physics in the recent update, the performance was too inconsistent across various game modes. As a result, we have reverted the physics to the way they were before this update.

Does this mean the physics won't be improved?
While the changes should be more consistent across every mode, they are still not perfect. We are working hard to release our new physics system and ensure steady and constant performance across every game mode. We will be providing updates closer to the release of the new system with more details.

Physics Adjustments

Kitchen Awareness Feature Added
Added an option for the kitchen to highlight in selected color (magenta, red, grey and green) and opacity (25%, 50%, 70%, 100%) when you are inside of the kitchen. 

Kitchen Awareness Options 
Added an option for a haptic vibration when you enter and exit the kitchen, for a chime when you enter and exit the kitchen, and an option for a representation of the position of your in-game feet.
NOTE: By default the Kitchen highlight is active with the color set as magenta and opacity at 50%, haptic vibration is active and feet representation is off. 

Re-centering Player Position Feature Added
Holding the Universal Menu button (also known as the “Oculus button” on your right controller) while in a match will reset the player position as well as the player rotation.

Party Voice Chat Feature Added
Within a few seconds of starting or joining a party, all members of the party will be able to speak to each other.

AI Net Hits Improved
AI will no longer fault every time when the ball hits the top of the net before they attempt to return the ball.

Scoring Voice Over Updated
